to.sven.androidrccar.host.logic.handler

Class AuthenticationMessageHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • to.sven.androidrccar.host.logic.handler.AbstractHostMessageHandler<AuthenticationMessage>
      • to.sven.androidrccar.host.logic.handler.AuthenticationMessageHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMessageHandler<AuthenticationMessage>

    public class AuthenticationMessageHandler
extends AbstractHostMessageHandler<AuthenticationMessage>
    This handler handles a received AuthenticationMessage. This message is expected after sending the GreetingMessage (so directly after connecting).
    Author:
    sven

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class to.sven.androidrccar.host.logic.handler.AbstractHostMessageHandler

        dependences, logic

      Constructor and Description
      AuthenticationMessageHandler(IHostLogicHandlerFacade logic)
      Creates the AuthenticationMessageHandler.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void AuthenticationFailed()
      The client HAS NOT send the correct password: The Client will be informed about that.
      private void AuthenticationSuccessfull()
      The client has send the correct password: The host goes from the initialize state into the ready state.
      private FeatureMessage createFeatureMessage()
      Creates the FeatureMessage from the IHostConfigurationService and the CarFeatures
      void handleMessage(AuthenticationMessage message)
      Checks if the client has send the correct password.
      private void registerHandlers(FeatureMessage featureMessage)
      Register handlers depending on the Features.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuthenticationMessageHandler

        public AuthenticationMessageHandler(IHostLogicHandlerFacade logic)
        Creates the AuthenticationMessageHandler.
        Parameters:
        logic - The IHostLogicHandlerFacade

    • Method Detail

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage(AuthenticationMessage message)
        Checks if the client has send the correct password. If: AuthenticationSuccessfull() If not: AuthenticationFailed()

      • AuthenticationSuccessfull

        private void AuthenticationSuccessfull()
        The client has send the correct password: The host goes from the initialize state into the ready state. This means all "normal" AbstractHostMessageHandler will be registered and a FeatureMessage will be send.

      • registerHandlers

        private void registerHandlers(FeatureMessage featureMessage)
        Register handlers depending on the Features.
        Parameters:
        featureMessage - The Features.

      • AuthenticationFailed

        private void AuthenticationFailed()
        The client HAS NOT send the correct password: The Client will be informed about that. (The communication is over.)

      • createFeatureMessage

        private FeatureMessage createFeatureMessage()
        Creates the FeatureMessage from the IHostConfigurationService and the CarFeatures
        Returns:
        A FeatureMessage with the features of the Host
